intro: Necalistis aspera, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in dry, open habitats. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. It produces yellowish-orange sap that can be irritating to the skin. Necalistis aspera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
